revised_title: Quantum Theory and the Brain: Exploring Consciousness and Information Processing
tldr: This article explores the possibility of describing the human brain using quantum mechanical terms, focusing on the idea that the brain operates as a pattern of switching. The author proposes an abstract definition of a quantum mechanical switch and applies it to sodium channel proteins in the brain. The study discusses the implications of quantum mechanics on information processing and unpredictability in the brain, aiming to provide a better understanding of the relationship between consciousness and the physical world.
